column5: Why not contact a local martial arts studio and see if they do performances. In particular they may offer self defence techniques for your female guests.  Just a thought!

Thanks everyone so far.  Hmm, I can just see it, "we need a female volunteer and a male volunteer from the audience".... Male volunteer ends up on his back on the floor after being beaten the .... out of him. That might go over well with the ladies and not so much with the men! LOL.  Mind you the lion dance thing might work as well or even a kata demostration. But would the mainly caucasian crowd think, "see this is what we get when an asian guy sets up the event".  Stan
LMFO!!!!! :lol  I won't tell anyone what I was thinking,LOL
There is a lady in Montreal that does a magic show with a red hankie.I think GCD is her agent..at least he has her video.... Joe

Hearingfish,  I was reading a free masons magazine tonight while waiting on a client and came across this advertisement.  Introducing Russell Roy " Corporate Entertainment" Humorous Keynotes for Corporate & Association Events  123 Tulloch Drive Ajaz, On, L1S 2S7 Toll Free: 1.866.599.0053 Web: www.russellroy.com e-mail: [email protected]  I have no idea what he does but it might be worth investigating.

ok I was going to wait....but I did a simple google search and came up with this...    http://www.corporateentertainers.ca/toront...m?source=google   there is a large genre to choose from and all do the Toronto area...  you should be able to find something there...   Gerritt.

Thanks Gerritt,  I know of the site, I just wanted to know if anyone has seen or been at an event with a decent lunchtime show (yes, keep it clean! LOL), word of mouth tends to show better than the corporate marketing.  Thanks again, Stan
Check these guys out. I book them every year and they are a smash. They may be hard to book however.  http://www.fiddlestep.ca/
Thanks JD for the suggestion.

Hi Everyone,  I'm looking for ideas, names, prices for entertainment for a lunchtime filler. Conference for the Association of Hearing Instrument Practitioners of Ontario. My first choice was Japanese drummers but that has just fallen thru and now I need to find something for Friday April 27th!      (I've been looking in the range of $1K to $2K for 1/2 hr to 1hr performance, in Richmond Hill).  Now, I've seen many things on this board and know many people have many possible contacts here so that's why I'm looking for any help from anyone here.  Please, any suggestions!  Thanks, Stan
Is the Major Mac still open?
DouG, I dunno, I don't go by there on my way to work.  Stan
Hire CCMT and Nautifish to do a Duet!   Gerritt.

"Lunch Time entertainment"...Leah was just bent over the couch looking for change under the cushions,,,,,  Sorry Stan...other than Doogles suggestion   ..can't help...  Maybe telling us the venue/people involved for what organization would help...
For $2000.00 for a half hour I'll dig some cardboard out and do a breakdancing routine for you.
Hey Wayne,  I just added it to the initial message but it's the not-for-profit association of hearing instrument practitioners of Ontario (AHIP).  BTW who's Mike?  Stan
Mike who...LOL
I'm still waiting for CCMT and Nautifish to notice thread.  Seriously, people, I need real suggestions!  Stan

Stan, a little research has shown that my suggestion was about 10 years out of date.  Not only was the place closed after some liquor license violation thingy, but I think the place was torn down.  Sic transit gloria.  And Charlene.  And Ember.  And Stormy.

Hi Hearingfish:  Maybe some of these might give you an idea or two... good luck!   Dick Felix Toronto Jazz Trio Toronto wedding band, Live jazz band for weddings and private functions, Live music for corporate events. I think a mime would be a perfect fit for an act like this...  cd.

wish I could have helped...my girl owns a gymnastics club and does presentations but that is the weekend they have provincial championships and all her girls are attending.  Too bad it wasn't another weekend.  Sorry bud

Thanks everyone for everything so far.  Jen - great options (except the last one from the UK, I don't think they'd come over here just for an hour's performance). I have the feeling the Ontario part of Manchester came up under a search.  Thank you for helping me so far.  Corey - just like all other health professions, ours is getting older as well, not sure how the mime idea would work out.  Charlied- thanks for the thought, it gave me an idea. I might inquire at my old high school's performing arts program.  Thanks, Stan

only "lunchtime entertainment" i've seen was "out of the office"....  if i remember correctly it had something to do with a stage  a brass poll and music with alot of bass, oh and a very charming young lady called Candy  sorry couldn't resist
If you don't want to spend any money than just play the old song "Afternoon Delight" and let nature take it's course.  Now if it's all guys you may................sorry couldn't resist!
. o O Put your hannnnnnds together forrrrrrr CANNNNNNNNDYYYYY !!!!!
Heck for 2k i will take my clothes off and give free lap dances.
Gee thanks Stan....I know my band isn't professional...but jeez.....we were not a real suggestion???? LOL.  Not sure if your crowd is the Green Day, Radiohead and Foo Fighters crowd anyways....

Okay people, lets keep it clean! The attendance will be about 300 people and most (~60-70%)are women!  Cliff, "real suggestions" wasn't meant for you but the brass pole thingy.  You may be right about the genre of music though, considering most members were requesting songs from the late 70's and early 80's the last time around. Although there are lots of younger people entering the profession.
I know what you meant Stan...just playin around with you a bit...
When I was in High School - (HIGH!!) - we saw Rush, Max Webster, April Wine etc at our noon hours!!! -  Ahhh - thoses were the days  - when a bag was $20  Sorry - flash back!~!!
Noticed.  Sorry no suggestions from me......GCD,GERRITT  LOL  But good luck all the same HF  Hope you find what you need for the event.
